message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.MM. 

The paper addresses the problem of distance metric learning, which is a common topic in machine learning and computer vision. The use of proxies to optimize the triplet loss is a novel approach that can be applied to various domains, including natural language processing and multimedia analysis. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also evaluates the proposed method on zero-shot learning datasets, which suggests a potential application in natural language processing, leading to cs.CL (Computation and Language) as a likely sub-category. Finally, the use of proxies to approximate the original data points can be seen as a form of dimensionality reduction, which is relevant to cs.MM (Multimedia).
